explosives.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though the substance contains unsaturated C-C bonds as chemical groups associated with explosive properties present.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Category 3 because of its flash point: 38 to 38.33degC(Hommel, 1991)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though the substance contains unsaturated C-C bonds as chemical groups with self-reactive properties present.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was set as Category 5 based on LD50=2276 mg/kg calculated by LD50 value of 4 examination of the oral administration in rats of SIDS (2004), ACGIH (2001), and PATTY (5th, 2001).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the description of LD50 = 8253mg/kg in rabbit percutaneous toxicity studies (ACGIH (2001)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Since the saturated vapor pressure concentration of this product is 5518ppm, it is thought that inhalation toxicity study was done with vapor. Based on the data 2717ppm of the male (SIDS (2004)) which is the lowest among LC50 values for rat 4-hour inhalation test for both sex, it was classified as Category 4 based on the technological direction.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There are descriptions that it has skin irritativeness and caused redness on humans (PATTY (5th, 2001)), and the result of the rabbit skin irritation study with four hour application was "slight" to "mild" (SIDS (2004)). Therefore, it was classified as Category 3.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the statement of "slight eye irritant" in a rabbit eye irritation test (SIDS (2004)), and based on that irritation was acknowledged in the eye by humans test (ACGIH and (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)), it was set as Category 2B.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the negative statement in the rat dominant lethality examination (SIDS (2004)), we classified it as Out Of Category.

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Since there is the description that there is the effect to parent reproduction (testicular tissue disorder, ovarian dysfunction and the decrease of the implantation rate and of the delivery rate), and the neonatal growth (the reduction of total delivery count, the number of the alive neonatal and the number of 4-day-long alive neonatal) with dose causing the general toxicity to parent animals (the Health, Labor and Welfare Ministry reports (2005), SIDS (2004), HSDB (2005)), it is classified into the Category 2

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (central nervous system); Category 2 (gastrointestinal tract); Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (central nervous system); May cause damage to organs (gastrointestinal tract); May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is the description that there are the malevolence/vomiting, headache, confusing, dyspnoea (PATTY (5th, 2001)), and it is classified into Category 1 (central nervous system). And there is the description that there is the irritation to nose, throat in the steam exposure to human, and it is classified into Category 3 (respiratory irritation). There is the description that there is the diarrhea, gastrointestinal bleeding, and gastrointestinal distension in the dose of the guidance value range (2000 > = C > 1000mg/kg) of Category 2 in the dermal administration to rabbit. So it is classified into Category 2 (digestive tract).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (liver) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In the repeated administrate oral toxicity examination using a rat, hepatocyte vacuolation is seen by the dosage in the range of Category 2 of a guidance value (10-100 mg/kg/day) (Health, Labor and Welfare Ministry reports (2005)), and in rat repeated administrate inhalation toxicity studies, morphological change and hardening of liver, and the degeneration of hepatocytes were observed with dosage (1.165 mg/L/6 hr/day) little higher than the upper limit of the range of Category 2 of a guidance value (0.2-1.0 mg/L/6 hr/day) (SIDS (2004)). Also in dog repeated dose inhalation toxicity studies , fibrillization of liver, the increase in deviation enzyme, and hyperplasia briliary tract are mentioned with the dosage of guidance value within the limits of Category 2(SIDS (2004)). It was classified to as Category 2 (liver) based on the above information.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be fatal if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 based on the description of severe pneumonia by aspiration in human (PATTY (5th, 2001)), and the description that when the fluid is swallowed, there is a risk of chemical pneumonitis by aspiration (ICSC (J), (1999)).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48-hour EC50=3.3 mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 1998).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 2, since acute toxicity was Category 2 and not rapidly degrading (BOD: 0% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though less bio-accumulative (BCF=160 (existing chemical safety inspections data)).
